description: Globally recognised professional certification for financial risk management, covering market, credit, operational and liquidity risk. View my digital badge here.

qualification: MSc in Computational and Applied Mathematics
description: Masters by thesis titled 'Turbulent hydraulic fracturing utilizing Prandtl's mixing length hypothesis'. This was awarded a distinction as well as best MSc in the School of Computational and Applied Mathematics. Scholarships included the Postgraduate Masters Merit Award and a National Research Foundation Scarce Skills bursary. View my thesis here.

qualification: BSc Honours in Computational and Applied Mathematics
description: Awarded with a final mark of 94%. Subjects included Mathematical Modelling, Computational Differential Equations, Optimization, and more. My research project was awarded a mark of 95% and resulted in a publication in the International Journal of Rock Mechanics and Mining Sciences. View the paper here.

qualification: BSc in Computational and Applied Mathematics and Mathematics
description: Degree awarded with distinction, with 17 certificates of merit obtained. I also served as the secretary for the Mathematical Sciences Student Council (2013).
